text: Cut broccoli tops into bite-size florets. Peel and thinly slice the broccoli stems, keeping the stems and florets separate. Toss the chicken strips, half the garlic and ginger, soy sauce, and sugar, 1 teaspoon corn starch, sesame oil, and salt to taste in a bowl. Marinate at room temperature for 15 minutes. Dissolve the remaining cornstarch in the broth or water.  Heat a large nonstick skillet over high heat. Add 1 tablespoon vegetable oil. When the oil is hot, add the broccoli stems and stir fry for 1 minute. Add the broccoli florets, red pepper, remaining garlic and ginger, and 2 tablespoon of water. Season with salt and pepper. Stir-fry until the broccoli is bright green but still crisp, about 2 minutes. Transfer the vegetables into a bowl. Get the skillet hot again and add remaining 2 tablespoon vegetable oil. Add the chicken and marinate and stir-fry until the chicken begins to turn brown, about 4 minutes. Return the broccoli to the pan and toss to heat through. Stir in the cornstarch in broth or water, and bring to a boil to thicken. Add a few tablespoons of water or broth if the sauce becomes too thick. Serve immediately with rice.
